Therefore said I, Look away from me; I will weep bitterly. The personal pronoun I now replaces you and your, which are used in the first three verses to refer to Jerusalem. I refers to Isaiah, who weeps bitterly and demonstrates great emotion as he witnesses this vision of destruction (21:3-4).

daughter of my people. Daughter is another name for Jerusalem (Lam. 1:6-8; 2:8; Zech. 9:9; 2 Ne. 8:25), and my people often refers to Jerusalem and Judah's inhabitants.
